contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox astronaut | name =Vladimír Remek | image = VladimirRemek.jpg | type =[[Intercosmos]] Cosmonaut | nationality =[[Czech Republic|Czech]] | birth_date ={{Birth date and age|1948|9|26}} | birth_place =[[České Budějovice]], [[Czechoslovakia]] | occupation =[[Member of European Parliament]], [[aviator|Pilot]] | rank =[[Colonel]], [[Czechoslovak Air Force]] | selection =[[List of astronauts by selection#1976|Air Force Group 6]] | time =7d 22h 17m | mission =[[Soyuz 28]] | insignia =[[File:Soyuz28-patch.png|30px]] |}} [[File:Vladimír Remek - modul.jpg|thumb|Module used by Remek to return to earth]] '''Vladimír Remek''' (born 26 September 1948) is the first [[Czechoslovakia|Czechoslovak]] in space and the first [[cosmonaut]] from a country other than the [[Soviet space program|Soviet Union]] or the [[NASA|United States]]. As of 2004, with the entry of the [[Czech Republic]] into the [[European Union]] Vladimír Remek is considered to be the first astronaut from the EU.<ref name="euastronaut">{{cite web |url=http://cordis.europa.eu/fetch?CALLER=MSS_NEWS_CZ&ACTION=D&DOC=1&CAT=NEWS&QUERY=01199b688a34:2021:39059c8f&RCN=29313|title= Commemorating 30 years of European human space flight |accessdate=2008-05-15 |publisher= EU CORDIS }}</ref> He flew aboard [[Soyuz 28]] from March 2 to March 10, 1978, for seven days, 22 hours, and 17 minutes. In 2004 he was elected into the [[European Parliament]]. ==Early life and education== Vladimír Remek was born in [[České Budějovice]] to Czech mother and Slovak father. His father, Jozef Remek, was [[Lieutenant General]] of the Czechoslovak army (1973-75 deputy of the Minister of Defense responsible for air force and air defense, 1976-89 commander of the air force). In 1970 Vladimír Remek became military pilot. In 1976 he finished a [[Gagarin Air Force Academy]] in Monino, Moscow Region. ==Intercosmos program and afterwards== Remek joined the [[Intercosmos]] program in 1976; his backup was [[Oldřich Pelčák]]. After the flight, on March 16, 1978, he and [[Aleksei Gubarev]], the other member of the crew, were awarded the title [[Hero of the Soviet Union]].<ref>{{ru icon}} [http://www.warheroes.ru/hero/hero.asp?Hero_id=1555 Biography] at the website on Heroes of the Soviet Union and Russia</ref> In 1990 he became director of the Military Museum for Aviation and Astronautics in [[Prague]], since 1995 he worked as a sales representative for the company [[Česká Zbrojovka Strakonice|ČZ]] in [[Moscow]], since 2002 he served at the Czech embassy in [[Russia]]. During the [[European Parliament election, 2004 (Czech Republic)|2004 European Parliament election]] Remek was an independent candidate for the [[Communist Party of Bohemia and Moravia]] and, being second on the list, was elected into the European Parliament. He was elected again into the European Parliament in [[European Parliament election, 2009 (Czech Republic)|2009 European Parliament election]]. The asteroid [[2552 Remek]] is named after him. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat-inline}} * [http://www.vladimirremek.cz/ Official website] (Czech and English) * [http://www.europarl.europa.eu/members/expert/searchForm/view.do?id=28330&language=en biography of Vladimír Remek at the European Parliament] * [http://www.lib.cas.cz/www/space.40/ASTRON/CSR/REME-V.HTM Short biography] (in [[Czech language|Czech]]) * [http://www.spacefacts.de/bios/international/english/remek_vladimir.htm Spacefacts biography of Vladimír Remek] {{Members of the European Parliament 2004–2009}} {{Czech Republic MEPs 2009–2014}} {{Authority control|VIAF=75225684}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Remek, Vladimir | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1948-09-26 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[České Budějovice]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Remek, Vladimir}} [[Category:Czech astronauts]] [[Category:Foreign Heroes of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:1948 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from České Budějovice]] [[Category:Communist Party of Bohemia and Moravia MEPs]] [[Category:MEPs for the Czech Republic 2004–2009]] [[Category:MEPs for the Czech Republic 2009–2014]] {{MEP-stub}} {{CzechRepublic-politician-stub}} {{Astronaut-stub}} {{Link GA|cs}}
